mdRecord.dcterms:title: The poor unhappy transported felon's sorrowful account of his 14 years transportation at Virginia, in America. : In six parts. : Being a remarkable and succinct history of the life of John Lauson, who was put apprentice by his father to a cooper in the city of Bristol, where he got into bad company, and went a robbing with a gang of thieves, but his master got him back, yet he would not be kept from his old companions, but went a thieving with them again, for which he was transported for fourteen years. : With an account of the way the transports work, and the punishment they receive for committing any fault. : Concluding with a word of advice to all young men to be upon their guard, lest they go through the hardships he went through.
